metadata.title: CVE-2021-47025 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:iommu/mediatek: Always enable the clk on resume In mtk_iommu_runtime_resumealways enable the clk, even if m4u_dom is null. Otherwise the 'suspend' cbmight disable the clk which is already disabled causing the warning: [1.586104] infra_m4u already disabled [ 1.586133] WARNING: CPU: 0 PID: 121at drivers/clk/clk.c:952     Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47025` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
